page.title: 05BLACHRUTHVEN FARM (2)
page.content: Is managed jointly with Glendevon and Newhouse farms - a total of 650 acres. At present 7 people are employed permanently, half of the number working 20 years ago. Casual labour from Perth works during the summer in the fruit fields. The farm operates a Pick Your Own system - families can have a day out fruit picking and picnicking. Machinery includes 3 large tractors, 2 small tractors for work between the berry rows, a plough, harrows, a seed drill and a strawberry planter. These are shared among the three farms. Fields divided by walls are being replaced by fences. Hedges are of hawthorn, ash, sycamore and wild rose. An irrigation system is presently being installed. Water will be drawn from the nearby Pow Burn. 1200m. of 150cm. pipe is required.
